channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: 'LEAKED BIDS' — Binance, Galaxy Digital among secret bidders for Celsius assets
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: Crypto blogger Tiffany Fong has shared documents she claims to have obtained in late December detailing several bids for Celsius' crypto assets.

item.title: UK's FCA hints at why its given only 15% of crypto firms the regulatory nod
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: The UK financial watchdog has received 300 crypto firm registration applications but has approved only 41 applicants.

item.title: CFTC’s Johnson urges Congress to expand commission’s crypto oversight powers
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Luke Huigsloot
item.description: Commodity Futures Trading Commission Kristin Johnson wants to protect customers in a way that reduces the risk of future crises.

item.title: US Senator Ted Cruz pushes for crypto in Congress ... using snacks
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: A newly introduced resolution could potentially see lawmakers buying sodas and chips using crypto-supporting vending machines.

item.title: Keep an eye out for major company NFT trademark filings this year
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: NFT trademark filings by companies aren’t just a marketing stunt. According to a trademark lawyer, they have to use what’s in the application.

item.title: Bithumb in turmoil, Binance’s 47K law requests, Axie players down 85%: Asia Express
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Our weekly roundup of news from East Asia curates the industry’s most important developments. Bithumb in turmoil  On Jan. 25, Yonhap Infomax reported that South Korean authorities had requested an arrest warrant for Kang Jong-Hyun, chairman and owner of cryptocurrency exchange Bithumb, over embezzlement allegations. That same day, the Financial Investigation Second Division of the […]

item.title: Data shows pro Bitcoin traders want to feel bullish, but the rally to $23K wasn’t enough
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Bitcoin price has flashed a few bullish signals, but traders are not too keen on adding leverage longs until after the Federal Reserve shows its cards on Feb. 1.

item.title: SEC once again rejects ARK 21Shares Bitcoin ETF listing
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: Proponents of the fund had argued that a current surveillance sharing agreement with CME would be adequate to protect investors.

item.title: Moody’s to build scoring system for stablecoins: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Moody's is allegedly developing a scoring system for stablecoins, with analysis of up to 20 digital assets.

item.title: ISDA releases standard definitions for digital asset derivatives
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The International Swaps and Derivatives Association is working on two papers to address fundamental legal risks in the crypto markets.

item.title: Here’s why Bitcoin price could correct after the US government resolves the debt limit impasse
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Nivesh Rustgi
item.description: Bitcoin price has been on a tear, but analysts warn that resolving the U.S debt limit issue could trigger sharp downside for risk assets like BTC.

item.title: Sens. Warren, Wyden question quality of auditors’ oversight in light of FTX debacle
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The senators co-authored a letter to the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board chair asking how FTX and other crypto firms were audited and why the audits failed so badly.

item.title: Polkadot restates its case that DOT has ‘morphed’ away from security status
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The Web3 Foundation has reminded the world that, in its eyes, it has conformed to SEC requirements and DOT should no longer be considered a security.

item.title: 88x Finance partners with Axelar Network for cross-chain yield aggregator
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The startup is one of the projects participating in the Axelar Ecosystem Startup Funding Program.

item.title: Binance stablecoin BUSD sees a sharp market cap drop amid solvency and mismanagement worries
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Kyle White
item.description: Persistent worries about Binance’s solvency, increased regulation of the crypto sector and questionable use cases are chipping away at BUSD’s market capitalization.

item.title: Porsche NFT trading volume nears $5M despite launch woes, minting halt
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Developers of the nonfungible tokens had halted minting on Jan. 25 in response to user complaints.

item.title: Opinion: Barry Silbert keeps quiet as Genesis goes down in flames
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Daniele Servadei
item.description: Genesis CEO Barry Silbert should have come clean after FTX imploded. Instead, he’s still deflecting responsibility for his company’s bankruptcy.

item.title: Crypto-friendly Stripe weighs public offering: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Sam Bourgi
item.description: In 2021, Stripe raised $600 million from a group of investors at a valuation of $95 billion, making it one of Silicon Valley's most valuable startups.

item.title: FTX legal team calls for Sam Bankman-Fried’s family to answer questions under oath: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Joseph Bankman, Barbara Fried and Gabriel Bankman-Fried could reportedly face questions in bankruptcy court about any financial benefits they may have received from FTX.

item.title: Aave purchases 2.7M CRV to clear bad debt following failed Eisenberg attack
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Following a failed short attack, DeFi exploiter Avraham Eisenberg was liquidated from Aave at a loss of $10 million.

item.title: US Justice Department seizes website of prolific ransomware gang Hive
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The group is known to have targeted critical infrastructure, healthcare providers and more over the past two years.

item.title: Bitcoin can still crack $50K if gold correlation continues — Chart
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: BTC price performance may encounter a new magnet above the $50,000 mark if gold continues to be a trendsetter.

item.title: Bitcoin dialogue at WEF requires ‘open-mind’ — Davos 2023
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: “It’s about taking inspiration from what we’ve done.” Lugano’s Plan B hopes to drive Bitcoin adoption dialogue at future World Economic Forum conferences.

item.title: The legal dangers of getting involved with DAOs
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Elias Ahonen
item.description: Buying DAO tokens? That’s no longer risk-free: Courts might consider you a partner in the business and judge you liable for millions in hacked funds. Another legal trap may be found simply working for a DAO — and implementing community decisions that turn out to be illegal in some far-flung jurisdiction. With many DAO communities […]

item.title: Inside the World Economic Forum: Circle, Ripple reflect on Davos 2023
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: A handful of cryptocurrency industry players who took part in workshops at the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting paint a picture of increased collaboration within the space in 2023.

item.title: Tether moves to combat child abuse content marketplaces
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: Tether is set to collaborate with anti-child-abuse network INHOPE to help the industry combat child abuse material marketplaces.

item.title: ChatGPT learns Bitcoin will end central banking and fiat currency
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Joseph Hall
item.description: A Bitcoin mentor convinced ChatGPT, the AI chatbot, that Bitcoin would bring about the demise of fiat currency.

item.title: Former Polygon VP of growth shares the secrets behind major partnerships
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Elisha Owusu Akyaw
item.description: Polygon’s former vice president of growth, Arjun Kalsy, believes that integrating zero-knowledge roll-up technology will boost the network’s adoption.

item.title: How PR needs to change in 2023
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ayelet Noff
item.description: PR “as usual” will move away from the norms we’ve grown used to, especially when it comes to utilizing Twitter for communicating with media.

item.title: How to mine Bitcoin at home
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jagjit Singh
item.description: To start mining Bitcoin at home, one needs to obtain a Bitcoin wallet and a mining rig, install the Bitcoin mining software, and join a mining pool.
